intro: Carmichaelia australis var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered kowhai, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its bright yellow, showy flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has compound leaves with lance-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain flat, winged seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and lowland areas. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
